item.title: Ticket #116 (The function which generate the 'nicename's is broken for unicode) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Yes, we should check for null strings and either prompt the user to provide a post slug that satisfies the character restrictions of RFC 2396 or autogenerate a post slug of the form "post #", for example, which the user can edit later.

item.title: Ticket #123 (Google-highlite problems) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: If the Google query string contains slashes, the regular expressions used by the highlighter will issue "Unknown modifier" warnings. The expressions need to be proofed against slashes.

item.title: Ticket #124 ("Publish" button is redunant and confusing.) created
item.dc:creator: tor
item.description:
Please remove the "publish" button on post.php The ability to set the status of the post should be taken care of only in one spot on a given page.

What happens when you do a writeup on something private, check the radio as private and hit publish? You have a conceptual collision on what the behavior of the publish button should do.

Basically, it comes down to the fact that if there's only one way of setting the post's status, there is *no* way confusion can occur due to UI conflicts.

item.title: Ticket #123 (Google-highlite problems) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When using the redirect feature offered by Google, if the WP weblog to which we are redirecting too has google-highlite enabled, it will not show to contents of the entry been redirected to or/an it will crash with PHP errors.

item.title: Ticket #122 (Next month link shows on pre-posted entries) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
If you pre-post an entry for the next month and foward from the current month, the link for that month will show on the calendar, but when clicked it will show no entries (as expected). See fix at:

​http://wordpress.org/support/6/5121

item.title: Ticket #28 (Use 3 type of dates for every post) updated
item.dc:creator: Anne

item.title: Ticket #120 (post_status=static not surviving edit) created
item.dc:creator: stevarino
item.description: I've been working with the new post_status = static setting for a few of my posts in a plugin, and I notice that when a user edits a post through the standard wp editor (using wp-admin/post.php and wp-admin/edit.php) the post_status == draft.

item.title: Ticket #119 ((more...) link not localisable) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: "(more...)" link at bottom of a post cannot be translated using the WP l10n system.

item.title: Changeset [1446]: If the new value and old value are the same, do not update the option ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: If the new value and old value are the same, do not update the option in update_option().
